commit_list.message:
Corrected bug: only the control entity had its screen position updated.

There are two places where I need to interpolate: for the position of the camera
and for the entities.  I had forgotten the second ones.  All the entities looked
immobile unless you centered the view on them.

commit_list.message:
Tiles have materials, which have physical properties: friction, bounce, etc.

physics.py:
* New class: Body.  It's a particle + a material.
* Material used in elastic collisions.

pygame_.py
* Image for the rubber tile.

solo.py
* Resolved circular dependency between word and world/gen by importing world.gen directly.  Most of world/__init__.py should go into modules.

gen/__init__.py
* New area generator using some kind of cellular automaton to have more interesting regions.  This allows the player/tester to feel how the different materials affect motions.

world/__init__.py
* Code for managing materials in friction and collisions.

world/materials.py
* New module containing the physical properties of the various materials tiles and entities are made of.

world/tile.py
* New tile nature: rubber.
* New constant, MATERIALS, to link a tile nature to a material.

World and View handle several areas.

Many new events, and therefore some new handlers, are here only to support
the test.  For example, it is not expected that the player can select the
entity he/she controls with a single key stroke.  The code makes relatively
clear what is likely to disappear.

commit_list.message:
Unittest for Event Management.  Corrected bug with weak references.

I used to store the bound methods for the handlers, but they contain a reference
to the listener, preventing the listener to be garbage-collected and therefore
disappear from the dictionary of handlers.  I now store the function of the
method.  Thanks to Dugres on Stack Overflow:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6975508/can-i-weak-reference-methods

commit_list.message:
Better separation of layouts and containers, size request optimization.

Layouts don't request the sizes of the cells anymore: that's the container's
job.  Therefore `requestSize` disappears from layouts and `_requestSize` is
renames `requestSize`.  This also clarifies the code.

It is now possible to request the size of a container without making this
container request the size of its children: parameter `forward_request` of
the method `requestSize`.

No more EXPAND_* constants on Cells, just use the strings. Readibility++.

commit_list.repo_description: Tile-based turn-based 3D game engine.

commit_list.message: Floors and walls have passability flags.
commit_list.repo_description: Tile-based turn-based 3D game engine.

commit_list.message: Properly used glfw.True/False instead of 1/0 in windows hints.
commit_list.repo_description: Tile-based turn-based 3D game engine.

commit_list.message: Stopped cashing gl.program values are they are not guaranteed to remain constant throughout the lifetime of the application.  Instead, cached the Shader References, and call Programs.Serve(shader references).  That way, even though slower, is more robust.
commit_list.repo_description: Tile-based turn-based 3D game engine.

commit_list.message: Ceiligs done.  We now have the bare minimum for a maze.
commit_list.repo_description: Tile-based turn-based 3D game engine.

commit_list.message: Place walls with R, remove them with Backspace.
commit_list.repo_description: Tile-based turn-based 3D game engine.

commit_list.repo_description: Tile-based turn-based 3D game engine.

commit_list.repo_description: Tile-based turn-based 3D game engine.
